alert.note: Alert for Clermont; Hamilton; Warren (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 15 at 10:09AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Northeastern Hamilton County, southern Warren County, and northern Clermont County. * WHEN...Until 100 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1006 AM EDT, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 1.5 inches are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Mount Repose, Milford, Indian Hills, Madeira, Goshen, Loveland, Maineville, Mulberry, Mason, Sharonville, Blue Ash, Reading, Montgomery, Deer Park, Mariemont, Terrace Park, Morrow and Kings Island.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
